comments.comment: Hi, I've been testing around this week with photoprism this week, so I'm also a new user. As I'm using Windows OS as client operating system , I always start with an abosolut path like C:/pictures:/home....... . The ~ symbol presents current directory of user. You have to share drive C: or whatsoever in Docker and configure the service for using Linux Containers

Yes, maybe ~ in the docker compose config can be an issue on some operating systems. Was this Windows? We've never tested our app on Windows so far. PS: Sorry for the delay, I had to complete a commercial project to fund this. Development continues soon!

I had the same issue using photoprism/photoprism:20190927. I am new to Photoprism but seems found a workaround. Try <denchmark-code> volumes: - "~/Photos:/home/photoprism/Pictures" # [local path]:[container path] - "photoprism-cache:/home/photoprism/.cache/photoprism" # keep thumbnail cache - "photoprism-database:/home/photoprism/.local/share/photoprism/resources/database" # keep database files </denchmark-code>

I can confirm this bug. It occurs, when /home/photoprism/Pictures/Import/upload/ and /home/photoprism/Pictures/Originals/ are not on the same filesystem. The problem is caused by the use of : <denchmark-link:https://github.com/photoprism/photoprism/blob/develop/internal/photoprism/mediafile.go#L438>https://github.com/photoprism/photoprism/blob/develop/internal/photoprism/mediafile.go#L438</denchmark-link>
A possible fix is to copy and then delete the file, if it needs to be moved between filesystems as stated here: <denchmark-link:https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/golang-dev/5w7Jmg_iCJQ>https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/golang-dev/5w7Jmg_iCJQ</denchmark-link>
